name: 'WickedPool'
description: Part sketch comedy, part rock concert, part keg party – and all for charity! Players is the intersection between a raucous, beer-fuelled rock-concert, a hilarious and punchy sketch comedy show, and a charity fundraising cabaret. Players is excited to present 'WickedPool': When a group of X-Men variants are pruned to the “Wonderful” World of Oz, they get friendly with the colourful, musical, locals. When word comes that the Wizard is in danger, the super teams of horny magical freaks must race along the yellow brick road to reach the Emerald City and save him from the clutches of a misguided sapphire mutant.

name: Carriage Trade Designer Showcase – Round Two
description: Carriage Trade’s Canadian Designer Showcase is back for Round Two, running May 1–30, 2025! This exciting competition invites Canadian fashion designers to submit their Fall/Winter 2025 collections for a chance to be featured in Carriage Trade, a destination for luxury fashion located in Toronto’s upscale Kingsway neighbourhood. Buyer and boutique owner Nori Mirza is on the hunt for standout, Canadian-made womenswear and women's accessories that embodies elegance, quality, and innovation. Held in partnership with the Toronto Fashion Incubator (TFI), this innovative initiative supports emerging and established talent by providing retail exposure, mentorship, and industry recognition for Toronto and Canadian designers.

name: Bandura on Bloor: Mariia Smolinska and DIVKA
description:
A show featuring Victoria-based Ukrainian bandurist Mariia Smolinska and Toronto-based folk fatale duet band DIVKA! 

Presented by the Toronto Bandura Festival, Bandura on Bloor is a musical concert series in Toronto showcasing solo bandura performers, small ensembles, and bands featuring the bandura. Join us for this delightful opportunity to spend your Friday evening with the magical sounds of the bandura in downtown Toronto!

This performance will be followed by a post-concert reception for all the guests and performers.

All net proceeds from this event will be donated to the Canada-Ukraine Foundation.

name: Kamamooshkaming Sagiiwehwining Music & Arts Festival
description: Honouring the start of Indigenous History Month, this Indigenous music and arts festival will feature performances, workshops, an artisan market, and historical and cultural presentations with Indigenous Elders, Knowledge Keepers, and creators. While commemorating the legacies of Gord Downie and Chanie Wenjack, the festival will celebrate Indigenous artists, music, and meaningful actions toward reconciliation.

name: The Wasteland
description:
A full theatre production brought to you by Awkward Arts Co. and Rogue Heels Co., combining theatre, dance, live music, and aerial arts!

Set in a post-apocalyptic future, this epic show follows a community of rebels on their journey through the wastelands and beyond, as they band together to rise up against the system. 

Brought to life by a stellar cast of collective dancers and guest performers of all levels and backgrounds. Featuring a variety of dance styles and musical genres, from heels to silks to contemporary, folk music to EDM to punk rock - something for everyone!

name: World of Travel™ Trade & Taste EXPO (WTTT EXPO)
description:
WTTT EXPO is a global marketplace bringing together leading professionals and businesses from travel, tourism, trade and investment. This dynamic event provides a platform for global and regional partners to connect, collaborate, and explore new opportunities.

WTTT EXPO highlights innovative solutions in sustainable development, promotes responsible investment, and supports the growth of emerging markets. It’s a space where industry leaders come together to showcase their products, ideas, and initiatives that drive positive impact across regions. With a strong focus on promoting sustainable living for a sustainable future, the EXPO emphasises creating responsible business practices that benefit communities, environment, and global economy.

name: Rosewood Revival with Belinda Corpuz
description:
Come experience an intimate night of live music in the cosiest music hall in town!
Enjoy some in house beverages and uplift your soul with four of the best musicians in town, gathering their talent to create a group where the microphone goes around for some of their originals. 

A coming together of four friends, featuring multi-instrumentalists and singer-songwriters Jesse Corrigan, Raha Javanfar, Tzevi Sherman and Adam Warner. During this rare and special evening, they will perform their own original music and take you on a journey from introspective ballads to uplifting bangers.

name: Prepare The Ground
description: A community-led arts & heavy music festival taking place across multiple venues - the first of its kind in the city

name: JazzInToronto Community Celebration 2025
description:
Brand new and all about celebrating the city’s richly diverse local talent pool.

From Swing and Bebop to Soul and R&B, rising stars to veteran virtuosos, the weekend will feature something for everyone.

Artists include Jane Bunnett and Marilyn Lerner, Michael Shand, Alex Samaras, Lady Son, Trombone Charlotte and many more.

name: Advanced Robotics with Spike Prime for Youth in Grades 6-10
description:
Delve deep into robotics engineering, programming, and creative problem-solving using the Spike Prime kit.

Students will explore its advanced features and capabilities  to design and build complex robotic systems, fostering innovation and critical thinking. No previous experience is required.
